question_text: What happens if a DHCP server is not available and a client cannot receive an IP address?
answer_options: The client creates a loopback tunnel
The client self-assigns an IP from the APIPA range
The device shuts down its network adapter
The client switches to static DNS mode
correct_answer: The client self-assigns an IP from the APIPA range
explanation: If a DHCP server cannot be contacted, many systems assign themselves an Automatic Private IP Address (APIPA) in the 169.254.x.x range.
